TopicTitle: K2 Kethane Mining Operation w/ Drilling Rig, Kerb-Kamp, KAS Fuel Truck, & Mobile Base

Articles.Content:
Craft File: K2 Kethane Drilling Rig

Mods required: Kethane Pack; Kerbal Attachment System

View in the VAB:

Total Ship Stats:

Parts: 720

Mass: 905 Tonnes

Electrical Capacity: 25,045

Liquid Fuel: 58,688

Oxidizer: 71,720

Monopropellant: 810

Lander Stats:

Parts: 313

Mass: 74 Tonnes

Electrical Capacity: 25,045

Liquid Fuel: 6,120

Oxidizer: 7,480

Monopropellant: 810

Crew Capacity: 2 (It's actually 5 but I self imposed a 2 Kerbal limit due to part clipping the Hitchhiker module)

Docked Craft:

(1) 2 Seat Buggy with a 2Hot Thermometer, Double-C Seismic Accelerometer, PresMat Barometer, and GravMax Negative Gravioli Detector mounted in the dashboard.

Kethane Gear:

Kethane Storage: 12,000

KE-C190 Heavy Converter Unit

KE-X270 Heavy Drilling Unit

KAS Gear:

(2) Horizontal Wenches, (2) 40 Capacity Containers with Radial Attachment Ports, Electromagnets,and Grapples

Undocked Buggy:

Before redocking exit the buggy. Line up the docking ports and apply brakes. Raise one or both landing legs closest to the ladder. The magnets should pull the buggy and dock.

Extracting Kethane:

Action Keys:

0 = Toggle Solar Panels, Antennas, and Sensor Displays (not record data)

1 = n/a

2 = Toggle Drill

3 = Convert Kethane to Liquid Fuel and Oxidizer

4 = Convert Kethane to Monopropellant

5 = n/a

6 = Toggle Ladder

7= Record Crew Reports and Sensor Data (you can choose to transmit data)

8 = n/a

9 = n/a

Feel free to try it out, kick the tires, or make any modifications.

Edited February 15, 2014 by Landge

Craft File: Kerb-Kamp

Mods Required: None.

View in the VAB:

The Kerb-Kamp was designed to provide long term housing in a single lander base.

Total Ship Stats:

Parts: 960

Mass: 1,447.5 Tonnes

Electrical Capacity: 8,047

Liquid Fuel (Total): 99,720

Oxidizer (Total): 121,880

Monopropellant: None

Lander Stats:

Parts: 406

Mass: 115 Tonnes

Liquid Fuel (Lander): 5,400

Oxidizer (Lander): 6,600

Monopropellant: None

Optimal Crew Capacity: 3 (1 Pilot and 2 Lab Techs)

Built with 6 Cupolas, 2 Hitchhiker containers, 1 Science Lab, and equipped with 1 Science Jr, 2 Mystery Goo containers, and 2 sets of sensors.

The lander uses (6) LV-909's for powered descent and to perform VTOL sub-orbital hops on low gravity planets or moons. Aerospikes can be sustituted for use on heavier gravity worlds. A single use planetary transfer stage with (8) LV'N's can be outfitted with additional fuel tanks (docked in orbit) for missions outside Kerbin's SOI.

Docked Craft:

(1) 4 Seat Buggy with a second set of sensors mounted in the dashboard.

Action Keys:

0 = Toggle Solar Panels, Antennas, and Sensor Displays (not record data)

1 = n/a

2 = n/a

3 = n/a

4 = n/a

5 = n/a

6 = Toggle Ladders

7= Record Crew Reports and Sensor Data (you can choose to transmit data)

8 = n/a

9 = n/a

Edited February 12, 2014 by Landge

Craft File: Fuel Truck

Mods Required: Kerbal Attachment System

View in the VAB:

Total Ship Stats:

Parts: 667

Mass: 901 Tonnes

Electrical Capacity: 8,265

Liquid Fuel (Total): 59,700

Oxidizer (Total): 72,600

Monopropellant: 1,660

Rover Stats:

Parts: 260

Mass: 75 Tonnes

Electrical Capacity: 4,230

Liquid Fuel: 4,260

Oxidizer: 4,840

Monopropellant: 910

Crew Capacity: 1

The Fuel Truck was designed to provide on the ground support and fuel service to landing craft and rovers.

The Fuel Truck uses (6) LV-909's for powered descent and to perform VTOL sub-orbital hops on low gravity planets or moons.

Aerospikes can be sustituted for use on heavier gravity worlds.

A reusable Planetary Transfer Stage with (4) LV'N's can be outfitted with additional fuel tanks for missions outside Kerbin's SOI.

It comes equipped with (1) Vertical Wench on the overhead boom, (2) Horizontal Wenches (Front and Rear), and (4) 80 capacity KAS containers.

Action Keys:

0 = Toggle Antenna

1 = Toggle VTOL Rockets

2 = n/a

3 = n/a

4 = n/a

5 = n/a

6 = Toggle Ladders

7= Record Crew Reports (you can choose to transmit data)

8 = n/a

9 = n/a

Edited February 15, 2014 by Landge

Craft File: Mobile Base

Mods Required: Kerbal Attachment System

Total Ship Stats:

Parts: 871

Mass: 1390.5 Tonnes

Electrical Capacity: 7,177

Liquid Fuel (Total): 95,400

Oxidizer (Total): 116,600

Monopropellant: 800

Rover Stats:

Parts: 418

Mass: 129 Tonnes

Electrical Capacity: 7,060

Liquid Fuel: 5,400

Oxidizer: 6,600

Monopropellant: 800

Optimal Crew Capacity: 3 (1 Pilot, 2 Lab Techs)

View in the VAB:

Taking the Kerb-Kamp to the next level with the addition of ROVER WHEELS and a REUSEABLE Planetary Transfer Stage!

You are no longer limited to sub-orbital hops on one planetary body. Once you re-enter orbit you can redock with the Transfer Stage. Thanks to the addition of KAS Strut Clamps yon can rest secured as you travel to other worlds. The Mobile Base uses (6) Aerospikes for powered descent and VTOL orbital hops on low gravity planets or moons. A reusable Planetary Transfer Stage with (8) LV-N's that can be outfitted with additional fuel tanks for missions outside Kerbin's SOI.

It comes with (5) Cupola Pods, (2) Hitchhiker Modules, 1 Science Module, 2 Mystery Goo Containers, 1 Science Jr, and a full complement of sensors.

Action Keys:

0 = Toggle Antennas, and Sensor Displays (not record data)

1 = Toggle Aerospikes

2 = n/a

3 = n/a

4 = n/a

5 = n/a

6 = Toggle Ladders

7= Record Crew Reports and Sensor Data (you can choose to transmit data)

8 = n/a

9 = n/a

Mun Mining Operation:

Edited February 15, 2014 by Landge
